citation.article-title: Delftia lacustris sp. nov., a peptidoglycan-degrading bacterium from fresh water, and emended description of Delftia tsuruhatensis as a peptidoglycan-degrading bacterium
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Delftia tsuruhatensisShigematsu et al. 2003
In the original description by Shigematsu et al. (2003), information on degradation of PG was not included.
Tests demonstrate that D. tsuruhatensis DSM 17581T is capable of degrading PG in both liquid and solid media, and that it possesses extracellular lysozyme activity (Table 1).
In contrast to strain 332T, no chitinase activity is found in D. tsuruhatensis DSM 17581T.
